::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module3_mcq_q97')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">
A stock has β=1.5, rf=5%, and is expected to return 14%. If E(Rm)=11%, what is the stock’s alpha relative to CAPM?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q97" value="A"> A. −1.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q97" value="B"> B. −2.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q97" value="C"> C. −2.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q97" value="D"> D. 0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q97" value="E"> E. +1.0%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module3_mcq_q97" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: C. CAPM required return=5%+1.5×(11%−5%)=14%. Stock’s actual E(R)=14%.  Correct answer: D 
</div>
:::
